info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 5:16AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Schenectady, Albany, north central Greene, south central Saratoga, east central Schoharie and southern Rensselaer Counties through 600 AM EDT... At 515 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Westerlo, or 9 miles southwest of Delmar, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Feura Bush around 520 AM EDT. Voorheesville around 525 AM EDT. Albany, Colonie, Delmar and Guilderland around 530 AM EDT. Watervliet, Rensselaer, Latham, Menands, Loudonville and Wyantskill around 535 AM EDT. Troy, Clifton Park, Cohoes, Green Island, Waterford, Center Brunswick and Wynantskill around 540 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Shakers, Bleecker Stadium, Clarksville, East Berne, Brookview, Shoefelt Corners, Glenridge, Albia, West Berne and Huntersland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 24 and 25. Interstate 90 between exits 10 and 26. Interstate 890 between exits 1a and 9. Interstate 87 between exits 21A and 7, and between exits 8A and 10. Interstate 787 between exits 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
